title: Special Edition: Diabetes and Influenza
cleaned_text: and Influenza This special series of Diabetes Core Update is supported by an independent educational grant from [Sanofi.](https://www.sanofi.com/en/your-health/vaccines) In this special three-episode series made possible by an unrestricted educational grant from [Sanofi Pasteur](https://www.sanofi.com/en/your-health/vaccines), [Diabetes Core Update](https://www.diabetesjournals.org/content/diabetes-core-update-podcasts) will explore the complicated relationship between diabetes and influenza. In each episode, Drs. Neil Skolnik and John Russell of Abington Memorial Hospital and the Temple University School of Medicine will present and discuss the latest clinically relevant articles and information related to the impact of diabetes on influenza-related mortality rates, influenza-related complications in persons with diabetes, and the important role clinicians can play in encouraging patients with diabetes to get their annual influenza vaccination. Users can listen to each episode by clicking on the podcast players below or subscribe on [Apple Podcasts](http://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/diabetes-core-update/id501572453) or December 17, 2020 [Diabetes Core Update: Diabetes and Influenza Series Episode Part 3](https://traffic.libsyn.com/preview/secure/diabetescoreupdate/Influenza_DM_3_Final.mp3) Play Episode Total Time: 23:51 | File Size: 34.4 MB In the third episode of this special three-part series, Drs. Skolnik and Russell address frequently asked questions related influenza, influenza vaccines, how influenza affects people with diabetes, and how health care providers can encourage their patients to get an influenza vaccination.
